meeting_title: Zero Emission Vehicle Interagency Working Group
short_description: This is a regular meeting of the Work Group.

The Oregon Department of Energy invites stakeholders to participate in the rulemaking process for the Alternative Fuel Vehicle Tax Credit and Alternative Fuel Vehicle Revolving Loan Fund programs. This is the final committee meeting to review draft rule language and other related topics, such as eligible project cost and the nexus with Oregon requirement.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion St. NE

short_description: The purpose of this rulemaking is to streamline and increase transparency of the requirements for facilities that generate electricity eligible for the Oregon Renewable Portfolio Standard. Included in the proposed rule amendments are: a description of the application process for RPS certification, notification requirements for facilities that undergo changes, renewal requirements for low-impact hydro facilities, requirements for periodic review of multiple-fuel facilities, and a one-time review of the performance of certain hydro efficiency upgrades. Facilities generating electricity from other eligible resources are not subject to review or renewal. The proposed rules also include updated references to the Western Renewable Energy Generation Information System Operating Rules and updated language regarding the tracking of stranded electricity.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion St. NE

meeting_title: Home Energy Performance Score Rulemaking Advisory Committee
short_description: Section 12 of 2013 House Bill 2801 requires the Oregon Department of Energy to conduct rulemaking to:  1. Adopt a voluntary home energy performance score system by which a person may assign a residential building a home energy performance score for the purpose of evaluating the energy conservation and energy efficiency of the building.  2. Designate programs for the training of home energy assessors.  3. Establish requirements, if any, for home energy assessors to report home energy performance scores they assign to homes to ODOE, and for ODOE to maintain that information in a database.  Prior to drafting rules, ODOE is engaging stakeholders on each of these three topics in a series of public meetings to be held through February 2014. The rules must take effect by July 1, 2014.
meeting_location: Oregon Training Institute, 27501 SW 95th Ave., Suite 980

meeting_title: Woody biomass sector of the Biomass Producer or Collector Tax Credit
short_description: The Oregon Department of Energy invites woody biomass stakeholders for the Biomass Producer or Collector Tax Credit to discuss program operations. The purpose of this meeting is to discuss written comments received from woody biomass stakeholders during the 2013 rulemaking.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Forestry, 2600 State St.

meeting_title: Renewal of RPS eligibility for certain facilities advisory committee meeting
short_description: The Oregon Department of Energy issued a policy statement March 19, 2013, in which it waived the requirement for facilities generating electricity from certain resources to renew their eligibility for the Oregon Renewable Portfolio Standard periodically. Those resources included solar, wind, geothermal, ocean wave, tidal current, ocean thermal, and municipal solid waste.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion St. NE

meeting_title: 1.5% Green Energy Technology rulemaking advisory committee meeting
short_description: ODOE is amending OAR 330-135 to implement House Bill 3169, which changed requirements for public bodies to include green energy technology in new or renovated buildings. Stakeholders will provide feedback on the draft rule language.
meeting_location: Local Government Center, Room 113 1201 Court St NE

meeting_title: Business Energy Tax Credit Rulemaking Advisory Committee
short_description: Although the 2011 Oregon Legislature replaced the Business Energy Tax Credit program with the new Energy Incentives Program, the department still must carry out its obligations to BETC participants before that program officially ends July 1, 2014. The Oregon Department of Energy invites Business Energy Tax Credit stakeholders to attend a rulemaking advisory committee meeting to discuss requiring BETC projects to report energy performance annually for up to five years after receiving final certification.

meeting_title: Energy Incentives Program fee discussion meeting
short_description: The Oregon Department of Energy invites stakeholders to discuss Energy Incentives Program fees for submitting an application, technical review, amendments, pass-through and transfer. At the meeting, department staff will review the current fees, program operations and possible fee increases.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion Street NE
details:
Under state law, ODOE may charge application and review fees to recover the anticipated cost of administering and enforcing the program. A chart with the current fees is located at: http://www.oregon.gov/energy/BUSINESS/Incentives/docs/EIPFeeChart.pdf.

Call-in number: 1- 888-273-3658; access code: 3125235

FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES TO PARTICIPATE
Following this public meeting, the department will review the current fees and host a second public meeting to continue the fee review and discussion. After the public meetings, ODOE will review comments, post a draft of proposed fees on its website and schedule a public hearing.

NOTE: To request an interpreter for the hearing impaired, or accommodations for persons with disabilities, please contact ODOE at least 72 hours before the meeting at 1-800-221-8035 or fax 503-373-7806. TTY users should call the Oregon Relay Service at 711.

meeting_title: Public hearing on proposed RETC non-catalytic woodstoves tax credit calculation
short_description: The Oregon Department of Energy posted an updated proposed 2014 tax credit rate chart for the current Residential Energy Tax Credit rulemaking. The changes relate to the tax credit calculation for non-catalytic woodstoves. The department is seeking to provide an adequate tax credit for non-catalytic woodstoves while considering the retail price and incentive percentage compared to catalytic woodstoves and pellet stoves.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion St. NE

meeting_title: Home Energy Performance Score Stakeholder Panel meeting
short_description: At the meeting, the panel will approve its charter, further review a system provider draft application, and continue discussing messaging and outreach to assessors. Ultimately, the stakeholder panel will recommend to the department’s director which home energy performance score systems to approve for use in Oregon beyond 2015.
meeting_location: Portland State Office Building, 800 NE Oregon St.

meeting_title: Home Energy Performance Score Stakeholder Panel meeting
short_description: The panel was created after recent Oregon Department of Energy rulemaking on home energy performance scores as directed by House Bill 2801, passed in 2013. Several participants in ODOE’s rulemaking effort expressed interest in working collaboratively toward greater market standardization. At the meeting, the panel will approve its charter, further review a system provider draft application, and review a communication piece for site assessors. Ultimately, the stakeholder panel will recommend to the department’s director which home energy performance score systems to approve for use in Oregon beyond 2015.
meeting_location: Portland State Office Building, 800 NE Oregon St.

meeting_title: RETC Energy Efficient Devices public meeting
short_description: The Oregon Department of Energy invites the public to attend a follow-up discussion about potential rule changes for energy efficient devices in the Residential Energy Tax Credit (RETC) program, such as ducted air-source heat pumps, ductless mini-split heat pumps, duct sealing and natural gas hot water heaters.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion Street NE

meeting_title: Amending Residential Energy Tax Credit pass-through eligibility rules
short_description: The proposed rule for the Residential Energy Tax Credit program is a continuation of the permanent RETC rules filed in November 2014. The pass-through eligibility section of the rule was included during the rule review and prior public hearing. However, OAR 330-070-0014 was not noticed as part of the earlier rulemaking because, initially, the Oregon Department of Energy did not propose amendments to this section of the rule. The proposed rule modifies the RETC pass-through eligibility to align with ORS 316.116. An eligible pass-through partner must be subject to tax under ORS 316.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion St. NE

meeting_title: 1.5 Percent Green Energy Technology in Public Buildings rulemaking hearing
short_description: The Oregon Department of Energy proposes to amend Oregon Administrative Rules 330-135-0010 to 330-135-0060, which describe the requirements for including green energy technology in the new construction and renovation of public buildings. The primary purpose of the rulemaking is to implement House Bill 3169, passed by the 2013 Oregon Legislature, which revised those requirements.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion St. NE

meeting_title: Home Energy Performance Score (HB 2801) Rulemaking Webinar

The one-hour webinar will consist of a half-hour presentation, followed by a half hour for questions from stakeholders.
meeting_location: Oregon Department of Energy, 625 Marion St. NE

This is to provide energy resource suppliers and other interested parties with information about the work of the agency and a summary of the department’s 2019-21 Agency Request Budget.
details:
The Oregon Department of Energy is hosting an open house and public meeting to provide energy resource suppliers and other interested parties with information about the work of the agency and a summary of the department’s 2019-21 Agency Request Budget. The meeting will include a full accounting of the projected revenue needed to fund each department program or activity and the projected allocation of moneys derived from the assessment authorized under ORS 469.421(8) to each department program or activity.

Wednesday, July 18, 2018
Open House: 1-2 p.m.
Public Meeting: 2-4 p.m.
Oregon Department of Energy
Meitner Conference Room
550 Capitol St. NE, Salem OR 97301

Prior to the public meeting, the Oregon Department of Energy will host an open house for the public to learn about ODOE’s program divisions, activities, and budget. During the open house, staff from each of ODOE’s program divisions will be available for informal conversations about the agency’s mission and work. The public meeting will start at 2 p.m., with presentations from each program division and budget staff.

If you are unable to attend the public meeting in person, starting at 2 p.m. you can access the meeting online: 
https://www.connectmeeting.att.com
Meeting Number: 213-270-2124
Access Code: 3125235

You may also participate in the meeting by calling 888-273-3658, and entering code 3125235.

This meeting is being held to inform the public about ODOE’s budget and to satisfy the public meeting requirement of ORS 469.421(8). Meeting materials and slides will be posted on our website prior to the meeting. After the presentation portion of the meeting, we will accept oral comments. Written comments related to the budget may be submitted any time until July 20, 2018, by emailing askenergy@oregon.gov. 

Learn more about ODOE's budget and access additional meeting materials online.

NOTE: To request an interpreter for the hearing impaired or accommodations for persons with disabilities, please contact the Oregon Department of Energy at least 48 hours before meeting at 1-800-221-8035 or fax 503-373-7806. TTY users should call the Oregon Relay Service at 711.

meeting_title: Small-Scale Energy Loan Program Advisory Committee Meeting
short_description: This is a regular meeting of the committee
details:
The Small-Scale Energy Loan Program Advisory Committee will meet December 22 via teleconference. The public meeting begins at 10 a.m.

The agenda will focus on consideration of a draft letter from SELPAC to the Oregon Department of Energy that recommends ODOE undertake a strategic review of the SELP program.

A complete agenda for the December 22 meeting, including information on how to attend the meeting remotely, can be found on the ODOE website at www.oregon.gov/energy/Get-Involved/Pages/SELPAC.aspx.

To request an interpreter for the hearing-impaired or for other accommodations, please contact John Hobbs at 503-378-5048. TTY users should call the Oregon Relay Service at 711.

About SELP: ​Oregon’s energy loan program offers fixed-rate, long-term loans for qualified projects that invest in energy conservation, renewable energy, alternative fuels, or create products from recycled materials.

meeting_title: POSTPONED: Oregon Global Warming Commission Forest Carbon Task Force Meeting
short_description: This is a regular meeting of the task force
details:
POSTPONED!

The Oregon Global Warming Commission's Forest Carbon Task Force will meet Tuesday, December 19, 2017. The public meeting will be held from 9:00 am to 12:00 pm in Conference Room Meitner at the Oregon Department of Energy (550 Capitol St NE) in Salem.

A listen-only call-in line will be available for those who cannot attend the meeting. Please call 1-877-336-1831, then use access code 872206. Please be sure to mute your telephone line during the meeting and do not place the line on hold, as it will cause hold music to play for all participants.

At the meeting, the Commission plans to discuss, among other things:
        ·  Findings from the OGWC Forest Carbon Task Force
        ·  Content for the 2018 Report to the Legislature

A final agenda and any background documents will be available 24 hours before this meeting at http://www.keeporegoncool.org/view/meetings-and-events.

To request an interpreter for the hearing impaired or accommodations for persons with disabilities, please contact Linda Ross at 503-378-6874 or linda.ross@oregon.gov at least 72 hours before the meeting. TTY users should call the Oregon Relay Service at 711.

The Oregon Global Warming Commission is a 25-member advisory group created by the 2007 Legislature through House Bill 3543. Members were appointed and directed to develop long-term policy recommendations to prepare for, adapt to, and combat global warming. For more information go to www.keeporegoncool.org.

To learn about the state’s efforts to address climate change, visit www.oregon.gov/energy/energy-oregon/Pages/Climate-Change.aspx.

Oregon Global Warming Commission
Oregon Department of Energy
550 Capitol St. NE
Salem, OR, 97301
503-378-4040
Oregon.GWC@oregon.gov

short_description: This is a regular meeting of the Commission
meeting_location: One World Trade Center, 121 SW Salmon Street
details:
The Oregon Global Warming Commission will meet Monday, June 25, 2018. Registration will begin at 8:45 a.m., and the public meeting will be held from 9 to 11:30 a.m. in the Skybridge Room at One World Trade Center, 121 SW Salmon St, Portland OR 97204.

A listen-only call-in line will be available for those who cannot attend the meeting. Please call 1-888-204-5984, then use access code 1763644. Please be sure to mute your telephone line during the meeting and do not place the line on hold, as it will cause hold music to play for all participants.

At the meeting, the Commission plans to welcome new members, discuss Oregon’s sector-based greenhouse gas emissions inventory, provide a forest carbon update and overview of Governor’s Office climate activities, and plan for the Commission’s next Report to the Legislature. This will be an informational meeting only; no votes will be taken.

A final agenda and any background documents will be available 24 hours before this meeting at http://www.keeporegoncool.org/meetings/.

If you need special accommodations to participate in the meeting, please contact Linda Ross at 503-378-6874 or linda.ross@oregon.gov.

short_description: This is a regular meeting of the Work Group.
details: At the meeting, members will provide feedback on the Biennial Energy Report, as well as updates on ODOE activities.

short_description: This is a regular meeting of the Commission
details:
The Oregon Global Warming Commission will meet Tuesday, October 16, 2018 in Portland. Registration will begin at 12:15 p.m., and the public meeting will be held from 12:30 to 4 p.m. in the Skybridge Room at Two World Trade Center (121 SW Salmon St.).

A listen-only call-in line will be available for those who cannot attend the meeting. Please call 1-888-204-5984, then use access code 1763644. Please be sure to mute your telephone line during the meeting and do not place the line on hold, as it will cause hold music to play for all participants.

At the meeting, the Commission plans for informational presentations from the Oregon Climate Change Research Institute on statewide climate impacts, the Oregon Coordinating Council on Ocean Acidification and Hypoxia on its first report and recommendations to the Legislature, and the Department of Environmental Quality on Oregon’s most recent greenhouse gas emissions inventories. The Commission will also discuss content of its draft Biennial Report to the Legislature. 

Three resolutions are expected to be introduced and voted on at this meeting: (1) Approval to finalize and send the Commission’s 2018 Biennial Report to the Legislature; (2) Approval to finalize and send a statement of support for a carbon cap to the Legislature; and (3) Approval to finalize and send the forest carbon report discussed at the last Commission meeting to the Oregon Department of Forestry. 

There will be an opportunity for public comment at about 2:40 p.m., prior to Commission voting. A final agenda, draft Resolutions, and the draft Biennial report will be available 24 hours before the meeting at www.keeporegoncool.org/meetings. 

If you need special accommodations to participate in the meeting, please contact Linda Ross at 503-378-6874 or at linda.ross@oregon.gov.

short_description: This is a regular meeting of the work group
details:
The Energy Advisory Work Group will meet Wednesday, October 24, 2018 at 1 p.m. at the Oregon Department of Energy to preview the Biennial Energy Report, review a draft charter for the group, and provide agency updates on the budget and legislative concepts.

An agenda and meeting materials will be posted online prior to the meeting. For those who cannot attend, the meeting will be recorded, and a recording will be available upon request following the meeting.

Information and notes from prior Energy Advisory Work Group meetings are available online: http://www.oregon.gov/energy/Get-Involved/Pages/Energy-Advisory-Work-Group.aspx

meeting_title: (In-person)Public Meeting on Chemical Waste Management Risk Assessment and Corrective Action Plan
details: In-Person Meeting September 30, 2020, 6 – 8 p.m. ODOE will host an in-person meeting outdoors at the Arlington High School football stadium (1200 Main Street in Arlington). Attendees are required to practice COVID-19 physical distancing guidelines and to wear face coverings outdoors whenever six feet of physical space is not possible. The school district will capture attendee information for contact-tracing purposes.

meeting_title: (Virtual)Public Meeting on Chemical Waste Management Risk Assessment and Corrective Action Plan
details:
Virtual Meeting September 30, 2020, 9 – 11 a.m. ODOE will host a virtual meeting beginning at 9 a.m. via the online platform WebEx. 
•	WebEx Link: https://odoe.webex.com/odoe/onstage/g.php?MTID=e61386b210821d632ebf60b962f87e41a 
•	If prompted for a password, enter Managers
We encourage participants to join online, if possible, so they may view presentation materials and submit questions through the chat function. An alternate phone number is available for call-in: 1-408-418-9388 (access code 173 016 8425).

meeting_title: RESCHEDULED FOR LATER DATE - EFSC Public Hearing on the DPO - Obsidian Solar Facility
details:
A public hearing, to be held remotely via webinar/teleconference. 

Zoom Presentation: https://zoom.us/j/99010585686

The Department strongly recommends joining the Zoom meeting via the online webinar, if possible. When you join, please use your full name so it is easier to identify attendees and manage public comments. Public participants will be in listen-only mode but can use the Zoom tool to “raise your hand" to share public comments. Additional instructions will be provided during the hearing for comments over the phone.

Join Webinar by Phone: +1-253-215-8782
Webinar ID for Call-In Feature: 990 1058 5686

For more details visit: https://www.oregon.gov/energy/facilities-safety/facilities/Pages/OSC.aspx

The Oregon Global Warming Commission will meet virtually, Thursday, May 13, 2020. 

You can join the WebEX Event as an attendee by registering via the link below. Registration does not open until meeting starts. You will be asked to enter your name, email and the event password then select “Join by browser” to be connected to the meeting.
  
Event Registration Link: https://odoe.webex.com/odoe/onstage/g.php?MTID=ec089f43851f3fa0f32a376eb17e0fe9b
Event password: ODOE

For more details, including meeting materiel visit: https://www.keeporegoncool.org/meeting-calendar/2020/5/13/oregon-global-warming-commission-meeting

The Oregon Global Warming Commission will meet virtually, Wednesday, June 24, 2020. 

OGWC Meeting- Virtual WebEX Event
You can join the WebEX Event as an attendee by registering via the link below. Registration does not open until meeting starts. You will be asked to enter your first and last name, email address and then click the Submit button to be connected to the meeting.

Event Registration Link: : https://odoe.webex.com/odoe/onstage/g.php?MTID=e5a0705ee59c0a62c1ec065209a715732

Members of the public are welcome to provide written comments for distribution to Commissioners in advance of the meeting through the contact form online or by email (Oregon.GWC@oregon.gov) through June 17, 2020, 11:59 p.m. Time will be reserved for additional public comment beginning at approximately 3:45 p.m.

​In an effort to achieve directives included in Governor Brown's Executive Order 20-04, the Oregon Department of Energy is convening monthly stakeholder meetings to discuss energy code development and code specifications and calculations, and to inform our code consultation to Oregon’s Building Codes Division.

https://www.oregon.gov/energy/Get-Involved/Pages/Energy-Code-Stakeholder-Panel.aspx?fbclid=IwAR1wYdP6t0teLTHeTSpysucpK7-7pWcMzfMUaYLgLl_wLHZF6uCFgxPejt8

meeting_title: Energy Advisory Work Group Virtual Meeting
details:
The Oregon Department of Energy will hold an Energy Advisory Work Group meeting on June 29, 2020. 
 
Please note this will be a virtual meeting with an option for remote online participation. Connection details will be available on ODOE's website ahead of the meeting.
 
Meeting Details:
Monday, June 29, 2020 |  1 - 3 p.m.
 
An agenda and materials for the EAWG meeting will be posted in advance on our website. We plan to discuss ODOE's budget, the 2020 Biennial Energy Report, and updates on other ODOE activities. 
 
The meeting will be open to the public in listen-only mode. Information from prior Energy Advisory Work Group meetings is available online.

Public hearing on the proposed Perennial Wind Chaser Station
short_description: This is a hearing on the draft proposed order for the proposed natural gas-fired plant planned southwest of Hermiston.

meeting_title: Public hearing on the draft proposed order for the Brush Canyon Wind Power Facility
short_description: The proposal is a wind-powered electric generating facility with up to 223 wind turbines and a 32-mile, 230-kilovolt overhead transmission line. The Oregon Department of Energy has issued the draft proposed order on the application for a site certificate, recommending the Energy Facility Siting Council approve the application and grant a site certificate.
